pullRequest.body:
We currently have two related but different concepts of Scott Continuity in Mathlib - `ScottContinuous` in `Order/Bounds/Basic` and `OmegaCompletePartialOrder.Continuous'` in `Order/OmegaCompletePartialOrder`. We previously showed (#6831) that `ScottContinuous` implies `OmegaCompletePartialOrder.Continuous'` (in general the converse isn't true).

This PR gives a more general definition of Scott Continuity, `ScottContinuousOn` which specialises to `ScottContinuous` and something equivalent to  `OmegaCompletePartialOrder.Continuous'` to give a more satisfactory unification of the concepts.

nodes.body: Can you now also replace `OmegaCompletePartialOrder.Continuous` by `ωScottContinuous` everywhere?

> Can you now also replace `OmegaCompletePartialOrder.Continuous` by `ωScottContinuous` everywhere?

I can't get anywhere with `CompleteLattice.iSup_continuous`

> I can't get anywhere with `CompleteLattice.iSup_continuous`

It's `e2'` that trips me up:
```
theorem iSup_ωScottContinuous {ι : Sort*} {f : ι → α →o β} (h : ∀ i, ωScottContinuous (f i)) :
    ωScottContinuous (⨆ i, f i) := by 
  have e1 : ⨆ i, (f i) = (sSup (Set.range fun i ↦ f i)) := by rfl
  have e2 : ωScottContinuous (⨆ i, f i) = ωScottContinuous (sSup (Set.range fun i ↦ f i)) := rfl
  have e2' : ωScottContinuous (⨆ i, f i) = ωScottContinuous ↑(sSup (Set.range fun i ↦ f i)) := sorry
  rw [e2']
  apply (sSup_ωScottContinuous' _ <| Set.forall_mem_range.2 h ) 
```

```lean4
  have e2' : ωScottContinuous (⨆ i, f i) = ωScottContinuous ↑(sSup (Set.range fun i ↦ f i)) := by {
    rw [← OrderHom.coe_iSup]
    rfl
  }
```
Does that help?
I've fixed `Order.OmegaCompletePartialOrder`. Can you take it from there?
